page.title: 11CHURCH OF SCOTLAND, LESWALT
page.content: Built in 1828 and standing at the east end of the village, Leswalt Church is a pleasing stone built structure serving the village and parish of Leswalt. There are 217 members and six elder districts 30 members homes are in Stranraer, 3km east and outside the parish. The church has a band of enthusiastic workers and, though not wealthy, seeks to serve the community in Christian service, public events and entertainment. In July, 1985, on the retiral of the Leswalt minister, the church was linked with that of Ervie-Kirkcolm (272 members) and the linked change is named Ervie-Kirkcolm with Leswalt. One minister serves both making the journey on Sundays from the 10.30am Kirkcolm service to the 11.45am Leswalt service. The linked parish now extends from the outskirts of Stranraer to the north
